structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases
Justices Of The Peace, Notaries Public And Commissioners

law.catch_line: Duty To Print Name Below Signature On Probate Matters
law.text: A justice of the peace, notary public or other person duly authorized, when taking an acknowledgment or administering an oath with relation to an instrument filed in a proceeding in the probate court shall print or type his name directly below his signature thereon. Failure to comply with this section shall not affect the validity of any instrument or the record thereof.
